User Comments

   (Comment on this title)
6 out of 22 people found the following comment useful:-
Movie not made in the right city or something, 23 February 2009

Author: dninc79 from United States

It wasn't HORRIBLE, but since i like Tyler Perry i almost had to force myself to watch this movie.

It was hard to digest almost, Im well aware the movie was meant to be mostly a comedy, but there was no plot or character build up.

I watched the stage play and it perfect as a stage play, perhaps the Big screen wasn't good of an idea. Im glad he's getting his money though, the Movie opened with a whopping 41 Million, i hope it makes tons of money, there are far worse movies that make loads of money.. The crowd that kept this movie from failing was his original fans along with Lionsgates fans and whatever fans he picked up from his past movies.

This dude is doing a lot of work, he's a Fellow New Orleanian Transplant so I'm obviously proud of him and he's a Black man so he's an inspiration to me and many others.

I wish that he would let people help him with these movies so they can "GREAT" Films, not "good" films.. Sometimes Location Location is the key.. Atlanta is not and never will be a good place to film movies, i wish people figure that out, do a search and see how many movies (not made by locals) have been filmed there. It's a Faceless cookie cutter city that looks like any other industrial college town. You could literally go to Houston Tx, Tampa Fl, Jacksonville Fl, Mobile Al, downtown areas and film a movie about Atlanta.

Was the above comment useful to you?
more
